The original version (PDF) is appended to this article as a Supplement.When prescription drugs became a new insurance benefit in the 1960s, companies known as pharmacy benefit managers (PBMs) started helping insurance companies manage the pharmaceutical part of the insurance business. The PBMs decided which drugs would be in the formularies, administered drug claims, and negotiated with drug manufacturers and pharmacies on behalf of insurers. Through these activities, PBMs offered value by containing drug spending.Over time, PBMs became larger and took on new roles.
